channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Universities across the U.S. freeze hiring as federal funding hangs in the balance
item.description: With uncertainties around federal funding for higher education, some schools are cutting back. Experts say that could hurt not only students and facul...

item.title: Passengers describe 'doomsday scenes' on hijacked train
item.description: More than 400 passengers were on board a train in south-west Pakistan when armed militants attacked.

item.title: Mahmoud Khalil didn’t wear a mask. He’s now the face of Trump’s crackdown on campus protests
NTSB urges ban on some helicopter flights at Washington airport where 67 people died in midair crash
item.description: Federal investigators looking for the cause of the January collision between a passenger jet and an Army helicopter near Washington, D.C., that killed...

item.title: Inflation eased a touch in February -- but Trump's tariffs cloud outlook
item.description: Consumer prices last month rose 2.8% from a year ago, slower than the 3% annual gain seen in January — but the prospect of a trade war is clouding the...

item.title: Ban on helicopter traffic around D.C. airport expanded in wake of American Airlines crash
item.description: A ban has been expanded on helicopters operating along the route involved in January's deadly mid-air collision near Washington's Reagan National Airp...

item.title: She advanced DEI at her university. Her son-in-law, JD Vance, wants to end it.
item.description: Lakshmi Chilukuri helped create a pilot course on race, ethnicity and gender in biology and medicine.

item.title: Somali forces end deadly 24-hour hotel siege
item.description: An explosives-laden vehicle blew up before gunmen entered the hotel, witnesses say.

item.title: Is the US really heading into a recession?
item.description: Stock market falls, tariffs and other changes are reigniting fear of economic downturn in the US.

item.title: What is known about the deadly January air crash between a passenger jet and US Army helicopter
Tugboat captain on how two massive ships collided at sea
item.description: Eddie Lucas, a tugboat captain and former "Below Deck" star, explains how a cargo ship crashed into a U.S. oil tanker off the coast of England. Despit...

item.title: Man who searched killing an "illegal immigrant" online arrested in murder of fiancé
item.description: Ty Vaughn, 31, allegedly shot and killed his fiancé hours after searching "is it illegal to kill an illegal immigrant."

item.title: Six things that could get more expensive for Americans under Trump tariffs
item.description: Economists say the president's import taxes could result in higher prices for a range of products in the US.

item.title: Mediators seek a new deal to release more than half of the hostages in Gaza
item.description: President Trump's Mideast envoy Steve Witkoff is taking part in ceasefire talks in Qatar, the most serious Israel-Hamas talks since Trump took office.

item.title: An urgent argument for the HPV vaccine
item.description: Data shows it can prevent six types of cancer. But anti-vaccine activists, including U.S. Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr., have helped dampen i...

item.title: Details on changes to Southwest's checked bags policy
item.description: Southwest Airlines is set to begin charging customers for checked bags, the last major airline to tack on baggage fees for most passengers. Hannah Tow...

item.title: Greenland's opposition wins election dominated by independence and Trump
item.description: The Democrats party wants a gradual move to independence but the second-placed party is keen to speed it up.

item.title: Congress reignites a bipartisan effort to ban hair discrimination
item.description: Previous attempts to pass the legislation banning hair discrimination have stalled in Congress.
